title: How to watch Yankees vs. Astros: MLB live stream, schedule, TV channel, start time for ALCS Game 6
text:
The New York Yankees saved their season Friday and now the American League Championship Series heads back west with the Houston Astros hosting Game 6 on Saturday night.

Facing a 3-1 series deficit, New York jumped on Houston starter Justin Verlander for four runs – on two homers – in the first inning in Game 5 and held on for a 4-1 win at Yankee Stadium. The Astros had won the previous three games in the best-of-seven series.

Now, back at Minute Maid Park, the Astros can clinch their second trip to the Fall Classic in three years. Their 60-21 record at home was the best in baseball during the regular season and they're 4-1 at home in the postseason.

Time: 8:08 p.m. ET

TV channel: Fox Sports 1 (find on your TV)

Live stream: FoxSports.com

Betting: Full odds, lines at USA TODAY Sports

Both teams are planning on a "bullpen game" Saturday with Chad Green opening for the Yankees and right-hander Brad Peacock starting things off for the Astros. Yankees relievers have a 2.27 ERA in 35 ⅔ innings in the postseason and have limited opposing hitters to a .168 average.
description: The Yankees forced a Game 6 with their win Friday night in Game 5, and now the best-of-seven ALCS moves back to Houston.
